text.div: SDC QuestionnaireResponse converted from the DEL Demo Client.

item.text: Section B: Hearing, Speech, and Vision
Comatose. Persistent vegetative state/no discernible consciousness

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Expression of Ideas and Wants (consider both verbal and non-verbal expression and excluding language barriers)

valueCoding.display: Expresses complex messages without difficulty and with speech that is clear and easy to understand

item.text: Understanding Verbal and Non-Verbal Content (with hearing aid or device, if used, and excluding language barriers)

valueCoding.display: Understands: Clear comprehension without cues or repetitions

item.text: Section C: Cognitive Patterns
Signs and Symptoms of Delirium (from CAM©). Confusion Assessment Method (CAM©) Shortened Version Worksheet
Is there evidence of an acute change in mental status from the {patient's/resident's} baseline?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Did the (abnormal) behavior fluctuate during the day, that is, tend to come and go or increase and decrease in severity?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Did the {patient/resident} have difficulty focusing attention, for example, being easily distractible or having difficulty keeping track of what was being said?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Was the {patient's/resident's} thinking disorganized or incoherent, such as rambling or irrelevant conversation, unclear or illogical flow of ideas, or unpredictable, switching from subject to subject?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Overall, how would you rate the {patient's/resident's} level of consciousness?
Section H: Bladder and Bowel
Bowel Continence - Select the one category that best describes the {patient/resident}.

valueCoding.display: Always continent

item.text: Bladder Continence - Select the one category that best describes the {patient/resident}.

valueCoding.display: Always continent (no documented incontinence)

item.text: Section I: Active Diagnoses
Indicate the {patient's/resident's} primary medical condition category

valueCoding.display: Chronic Cardiac Condition (e.g., heart failure)

item.text: If "Other Medical Condition", enter the ICD code in the boxes.
Active Diagnoses in the last 7 days: Check all that apply. Diagnoses listed in parentheses are provided as examples and should not be considered as all-inclusive lists

valueCoding.display: Diabetes Mellitus (DM) (e.g., diabetic retinopathy, nephropathy, and neuropathy)

item.text: Section J: Health Conditions
Has the {patient/resident} had any falls since {admission} or the prior assessment whichever is more recent?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Number of Falls Since {Admission} or Prior Assessment whichever is most recent

No injury - no evidence of any injury is noted on physical assessment by the nurse or primary care clinician; no complaints of pain or injury by the {patient/resident}; no change in the {patient's/resident's} behavior is noted after the fall.

valueCoding.display: None

item.text: Injury (except major) - skin tears, abrasions, lacerations, superficial bruises, hematomas and sprains; or any fall-related injury that causes the {patient/resident} to complain of pain

valueCoding.display: None

item.text: Major injury - bone fractures, joint dislocations, closed head injuries with altered consciousness, subdural hematoma

valueCoding.display: None

item.text: Section K: Swallowing/Nutritional Status
Height and Weight - While measuring, if the number is X.1 - X.4 round down; X.5 or greater round up
Height (in inches). Record most recent height measure since {admission}

Weight (in pounds). Base weight on most recent measure in last {specify time period in days}; measure weight consistently, according to standard {facility/setting} practice (e.g., in a.m. after voiding, before meal, with shoes off, etc.)
Section M: Skin Conditions
Unhealed Pressure Ulcers/Injuries. Does this {patient/resident} have one or more unhealed pressure ulcers/injuries?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Current Number of Unhealed Pressure Ulcers/Injuries at Each Stage

Stage 1: Intact skin with non-blanchable redness of a localized area usually over a bony prominence. Darkly pigmented skin may not have a visible blanching; in dark skin tones only it may appear with persistent blue or purple hues
Stage 2: Partial thickness loss of dermis presenting as a shallow open ulcer with a red or pink wound bed, without slough. May also present as an intact or open/ruptured blister.

Stage 3: Full thickness tissue loss. Subcutaneous fat may be visible but bone, tendon or muscle is not exposed. Slough may be present but does not obscure the depth of tissue loss. May include undermining and tunneling
Stage 4: Full thickness tissue loss with exposed bone, tendon or muscle. Slough or eschar may be present on some parts of the wound bed. Often includes undermining and tunneling
Unstageable - Non-removable dressing/device: Known but not stageable due to non-removable dressing/device
Unstageable - Slough and/or eschar: Known but not stageable due to coverage of wound bed by slough and/or eschar
Unstageable - Deep tissue injury
Section N: Medications
Drug Regimen Review: Did a complete drug regimen review identify potential clinically significant medication issues?

valueCoding.display: No - No issues found during review

item.text: Medication Follow-up. Did the {facility/setting} contact a physician (or physician-designee) by midnight of the next calendar day and complete prescribed/recommended actions in response to the identified potential clinically significant medication issues?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Medication Intervention. Did the {facility/setting} contact and complete physician (or physician-designee) prescribed/recommended actions by midnight of the next calendar day each time potential clinically significant medication issues were identified since the {admission}?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Section O: Special Treatments, Procedures, and Programs
Influenza Vaccine - Refer to the current version of the {manual} for current influenza vaccination season and reporting period
Did the {patient/resident} receive the influenza vaccine in this {facility/setting} for this year's influenza vaccination season?

valueCoding.display: Yes

item.text: If influenza vaccine not received, state reason

valueCoding.display: Received outside of this facility

item.text: Date influenza vaccine received
Special Treatments, Procedures, and Programs. Check all of the following treatments, procedures, and programs that were performed

valueCoding.display: IV Medications

item.text: Spontaneous Breathing Trial (SBT) (including Tracheostomy Collar or Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) Breathing Trial) by Day 2 of the {LTCH} stay.
Invasive Mechanical Ventilator Support upon {admission} to the {LTCH}

valueCoding.display: No, not on invasive mechanical ventilation support

item.text: Assessed for readiness for SBT by day 2 of the {LTCH} stay (Note: Day 2 = Date of Admission to the {LTCH} (Day 1) + 1 calendar day)

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Deemed medically ready for SBT by day 2 of the {LTCH} stay

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Is there documentation of reason(s) in the {patient's/resident's} medical record that the {patient/resident} was deemed medically unready for SBT by day 2 of the {LTCH} stay?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: SBT performed by day 2 of the {LTCH} stay

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Ventilator Liberation Rate
Invasive Mechanical Ventilator: Liberation Status at Discharge

valueCoding.display: NA (Code only if the {patient/resident} was non-weaning or not ventilated on admission)

item.text: Section GG: Functional Abilities and Goals
Prior Functioning: Everyday Activities. Indicate the {patient's/resident's} usual ability with everyday activities prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury

Indoor Mobility (Ambulation): Code the {patient's/resident's} need for assistance with walking from room to room (with or without a device such as cane, crutch, or walker) prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.

valueCoding.display: Needed Some Help - {Patient/Resident} needed partial assistance from another person to complete activities.

item.text: Self-Care. Code the {patient's/resident's} usual performance at {admission} for each activity using the 6-point scale. If activity was not attempted at {admission}, code the reason. Code the {patient's/resident's} {discharge} goal(s) using the 6 point scale. Use of codes 07, 09, 10, or 88 is permissible to code {discharge} goal(s).
Eating: The ability to use suitable utensils to bring food and/or liquid to the mouth and swallow food and/or liquid once the meal is placed before the {patient/resident}. - Admission Performance

valueCoding.display: Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does LESS THAN HALF the effort. Helper lifts, holds, or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.

item.text: Oral hygiene: The ability to use suitable items to clean teeth. Dentures (if applicable): The ability to insert and remove dentures into and from the mouth, and manage denture soaking and rinsing with use of equipment. - Admission Performance

valueCoding.display: Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does LESS THAN HALF the effort. Helper lifts, holds, or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.

item.text: Toileting hygiene: The ability to maintain perineal hygiene, adjust clothes before and after voiding or having a bowel movement. If managing an ostomy, include wiping the opening but not managing equipment. - Admission Performance

valueCoding.display: Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does LESS THAN HALF the effort. Helper lifts, holds, or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.

item.text: Wash Upper Body: The ability to wash, rinse, and dry the face, hands, chest, and arms while sitting in a chair or bed. - Admission Performance

valueCoding.display: Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does LESS THAN HALF the effort. Helper lifts, holds, or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.
